body:
Comment 5: 
FWIW, looking at some prior art from around the web:

"Windows x86 MSI Installer (2.7.2)"
http://www.python.org/ftp/python/2.7.2/python-2.7.2.msi

"Windows X86-64 MSI Installer (2.7.2)"
http://www.python.org/ftp/python/2.7.2/python-2.7.2.amd64.msi

Windows 64-bit installs 32-bit programs in C:\Program Files (x86).

I've seen references to x86 vs x64 and w32 vs w64 in relation to MinGW.

"Eclipse Windows 32-bit"
eclipse-jee-indigo-SR2-win32.zip

"Eclipse Windows 64-bit"
eclipse-jee-indigo-SR2-win32-x86_64.zip

Java:

"Windows"
java_ee_sdk-6u4-jdk7-windows.exe

"Windows x64"
java_ee_sdk-6u4-jdk7-windows-x64.exe

Microsoft also uses x64: "Windows Server 2008 x64"

x64 looks like a good name for 64-bit. No clear winner for 32-bit emerges.
